html.p: To use Zero Install, you will need:

ul.li: GObject/GTK (2.12 or later needed for CLI/GUI).
PyGObject/PyGTK (2.12 or later needed for CLI/GUI).

html.p:
The installation process assumes a familiarity with the Terminal and Developer Tools.
There is no installer available for Mac OS X yet, so it needs to be built from source...

The easiest way of installing Zero Install and its requirements is by using a “package
manager”, to handle building both it and the dependencies (mentioned above) for you:

You can either install Zero Install for the regular Mac OS X (Quartz) with JHBuild,
or for its Darwin BSD sub-system (using X11) using MacPorts, Fink or Homebrew.

You now have two new commands: 0launch, which takes the URL of a program and runs it, and 0alias, which lets you use short names instead of URLs.
You need to do four installations and two compilations, for requirements:

li.p: Install Python 2.5+, from python.org / download (if needed)

ul.li: python-2.5.4-macosx.dmg (Universal Binary, for Mac OS X 10.3.9 and later) $ python --version

li.p: Compile GTK from source, using jhbuild

You will need the Xcode Tools for this, installed separately.
Comes bundled with the OS, but needs to be updated at ADC.

You cannot mix the GTK-OSX installation with MacPorts/Fink,
so make sure that those are not in the PATH/FLAGS variables...

li.pre:
$ sh gtk-osx-build-setup.sh $ PATH=$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH $ export PATH $ jhbuild bootstrap
$ jhbuild build meta-gtk-osx-bootstrap $ jhbuild build meta-gtk-osx-core
